instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-02020: What is 820-02020? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not drawing 20V stuck at 5v
threads.message: Macbook came in as dead, did a physical inspection on the board, found a hairline crack on the <CHIP>U5200</CHIP>, replaced it. No PPBUS short. Board is not drawing 20V. Your input will be highly appreciated.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not drawing 20V stuck at 5v
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not drawing 20V stuck at 5v
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not drawing 20V stuck at 5v
threads.message: This is a surprise, pls, enlighten me, how can a board that is only able to draw 5V have 12V on it??

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not drawing 20V stuck at 5v
threads.message:
Since 2015/6, MacBook boards have buck-boost converter on input.
Didn't think why there are 2 MOSFET pairs (<TRANSISTOR>Q5230</TRANSISTOR>/40, before and after L5230)?

<SIGNAL>3V8_AON</SIGNAL> present?
Check some PMU LDOs.

Did you try DFU?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not drawing 20V stuck at 5v
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>3V8_AON</SIGNAL> is present 
Pls can you specify the PMU and LDOs
It didn't enter DFU
But I did check some coils at the <CHIP>U8100</CHIP>
L8100 that should be 1.06V was 0.7V
L8110 no voltage present
L8280 that should be 0.94V has 0.7V
All other coils voltage are present

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not drawing 20V stuck at 5v
threads.message:
Be sure to check ALWAYS voltage on the output pin of the coils; where the filter cap is placed.

PMU LDOs on page 28 & 33.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not drawing 20V stuck at 5v
threads.message:
<CHIP>U7700</CHIP>
L77D0 has 1.2V present
L7740 has 1.06V present
L77C0 has 0.8V present
<CAPACITOR>C7700</CAPACITOR>/<CAPACITOR>C7701</CAPACITOR> has 3.8V present
C780D has 0.78V present
<CAPACITOR>C7805</CAPACITOR> has 1.2V present
L800 has 3.8V present on pin 1 and 5V present on pin 2
<CAPACITOR>C7825</CAPACITOR> has 5V present
<CHIP>U8100</CHIP>
L8230 has a pulsing Voltage
L84E0 no voltage
L8290 pulsing
C81F3 3.8V present
L8281 pulsing
L8280 pulsing

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not drawing 20V stuck at 5v
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not drawing 20V stuck at 5v
threads.message:
L800 has 3.8V present on pin 1 and 5V present on pin 2
<RESISTOR>R8422</RESISTOR> no voltage present, there pulsing signal there

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not drawing 20V stuck at 5v
threads.message:
L800 doesn't appear in pdf search...

Check diode mode to ground at L84E0.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not drawing 20V stuck at 5v
threads.message:
Apologies L7800, I mean
L84E0 0.307 in diode mode

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not drawing 20V stuck at 5v
threads.message:
L7800 MUST have 3.8V on pin 2; comes from <SIGNAL>3V8_AON</SIGNAL>.
If you get 5V at <CAPACITOR>C7800</CAPACITOR>, is OK.

Check for short on all big coils.
Also check at small coils near <CHIP>U7700</CHIP> and <CHIP>U8100</CHIP>; especially the ones without voltage pulse.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not drawing 20V stuck at 5v
threads.message:
L7800/2 is connected to <CAPACITOR>C7800</CAPACITOR>/1 and it has 5V on it. L7800/1 has 3.8V on it.
I've checked all coils around <CHIP>U7700</CHIP> and <CHIP>U8100</CHIP>, they are not shorted.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not drawing 20V stuck at 5v
threads.message:
Do you still have pulsing L82xx coils?
You've said 0.7V on L8280 before; supposedly not pulsing.

BTW, always check DC voltage on the coils output pin, where the filter caps are placed.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not drawing 20V stuck at 5v
threads.message: Yes, there's no longer 0.7V, they are all pulsing

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not drawing 20V stuck at 5v
